item.title: All LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt Codes & How to Redeem Them
item.content:encoded:
2026 is set to be a big year for Pokémon, with the 30th anniversary celebrations kicking off, and the long-awaited LEGO collab has had a full reveal, with a scavenger hunt commencing to find codes that can be redeemed for an array of prizes.

LEGO officially revealed the first five Pokémon sets on January 12, with sizes and prices ranging from the small and fairly affordable to the gigantic and money-spinning, while two of the sets are exclusively available as a gift with purchase or via LEGO Insider points redemption.

Following the reveal of the sets, LEGO also revealed details of a special Pokémon Scavenger Hunt offering an array of prizes, and Insider Gaming has all the known codes so far here, with more added as they are discovered.

All LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt Codes

Codes in the LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt will be slowly unearthed right up until Pokémon Day, when the franchise celebrates its 30th anniversary, on February 27, 2026.

A total of 30 codes will be available during the event, which can be redeemed to enter the sweepstakes to win a variety of prizes. Codes will be hidden on the official LEGO website, social media pages, the Pokémon Go app, the official Pokémon website, the Pokémon Center website, and on the videos of select YouTubers.

To make it easier for you, and to ensure you don’t miss out on a code, Insider Gaming has gathered all the codes discovered so far in the table below. Make sure to bookmark this page, as it will be updated when more are discovered.

How to Redeem LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt Codes

Codes found in the LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt are redeemable on the official LEGO website, located on this page, for the Pokémon product lineup.

You must be signed in to your LEGO account to redeem the codes, and have an active LEGO Insider Membership. Fortunately, this is free to own, so if you haven’t created one yet, now is the time to do so.

When signed into your account, scroll down the page to find the area to enter your code, paste it into the box, and hit redeem. Codes can only be claimed once per account.

Along with the sweepstakes entries, redeeming codes also provide a variety of downloadable images featuring the new product lineup.

All LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt Prizes

An array of prizes is available in the LEGO Pokémon Scavenger Hunt, including LEGO sets and Insider Points, with the grand prize including a package to attend 2026 Pokémon Worlds.

A full list of the prizes is shown in the table below.

Have you purchased any of the new LEGO Pokémon sets? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out seven things to expect from Pokémon in 2026, and take a look at leaks seemingly confirming a Pokémon Pokopia post-apocalyptic fan theory.

item.title: ARC Raiders’ Most PvP Heavy Map Just Got More Intense
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders Update 1.11.0 patch notes reveal that Stella Montis is going to get even more intense as lighting has been lowered in several areas.

Embark Studios has several announcements for ARC Raiders players today. We were informed earlier that the game has surpassed 12 million copies sold, and they are providing the community with a free gift to celebrate. Now, new patch notes reveal nerfs to certain items as well as other changes to their PvP-heavy map.

What’s New in ARC Raiders Update 1.11.0? Stella Montis Lighting Change, Kettle and Trigger Nade Nerfs

Starting with the biggest one, right at the very bottom of the ARC Raiders Update 1.11.0 patch notes, players will see that a new change will be taking place in Stella Montis Night Raid. Stella Montis was already a PvP-heavy map with low lighting and angry Raiders thirsty for blood. Now, the lighting has been reduced in some areas, making the use of flashlights and listening even more essential. The change could lead to more sneaky tactics, such as camping in the dark and ambushing opponents.

Moreover, the Kettle’s fire rate has been reduced from 600 to 450, as the previous fire rate was only realistically reachable by players using Macros. The Trigger ‘Nade has been nerfed as well, as it was dominating PvP encounters and players were preferring it over the other grenades. The nerf will reduce its use as a “trigger-in-air” grenade while retaining its use as a sticky bomb, with the delay being increased from 0.7 seconds to 1.5 seconds. Lastly, a key card exploit that allowed players to keep room keys after using them has been fixed.

Complete ARC Raiders Update 1.11.0 Patch Notes

  • Kettle
    • Dev note: Reduced fire rate from 600 to 450. The previous fire rate was only realistically reachable by players using macros, which creates an unfair dynamic that favours using 3rd party software.
  • Trigger ‘Nade
    • Dev note: Trigger ‘Nade currently dominates PVP encounters, and players favour picking it over all our other grenades. This nerf aims to make it less usable as a “trigger-in-air” grenade, whilst keeping its usefulness as a sticky bomb. Damage falloff has been rebalanced to concentrate the damage closer to the center of the explosion, and deal less damage further away. The delay between triggering the grenade and it detonating, has been increased from 0.7s to 1.5s, giving players more time to react, and making it harder to time the detonation in air.
  • Fixed a key card exploit that allowed players to keep room keys after using them.
  • Lighting has been lowered in some areas on Stella Montis Night Raid making flashlights and listening more relevant.

ARC Raiders update 1.11.0 patch notes were released on their website today.

In other news, one million players have completed their first Expedition Project and wiped their accounts. Additionally, the developers are going to implement ‘significant changes’ to crack down on cheaters. What are your thoughts on ARC Raiders’ most PvP heavy map geting even more intense after update 1.11.0? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about dismissed Rockstar Games developers being denied pay while the legal battle continues. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: ARC Raiders is Offering a Free Gift For Crossing 12 Million Copies Sold
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders just keeps on growing, hitting a new milestone in 2026 of over 12 million copies sold, and the devs are offering a free gift to players to celebrate the occasion.

Embark Studios’ ARC Raiders is definitely one of the most popular releases in 2025, and is still going strong into the new year. The player base also includes a dedicated bunch, with 1 million completing their first Expedition Project. Now, you can grab a free gift for helping the game reach this milestone.

As revealed through the official ARC Raiders X account (formerly Twitter), the developers have confirmed that they have seen “over 12 million Raiders ascend from Speranza to raid the Rust Belt.” The dev team had crafted a special gift to celebrate hitting 10 million players, and this free thank-you gift is a Gilded Pickaxe Raider Tool. Any player who has logged in since launch until January 13, 23:59 CET, will receive this gift once the latest update is released.

Since its release, ARC Raiders has slowly and steadily cemented its position as one of the best extraction shooters ever released. Last week, a sales estimate for the game was released, stating that the title had already surpassed 12 million units across Steam, PlayStation, and Xbox. This seemingly helped Embark Studios rake in a whopping $350 million and reach a daily active user count of 3.2 million.

In other news, ARC Raiders players are complaining about false account blocks and bans. Additionally, we recently caught a glimpse of what ARC Raiders might have looked like if it were a first-person shooter. Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about dismissed Rockstar Games developers being denied pay while the legal battle continues. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
